review: Been taking amitriptyline for a little longer than 6 months now and for me it doesn't work.The pain and urinary frequency is still very much present and side effects are the reason I will stop taking this medicine. I have gained about 15 kilograms in weight since starting this medication. The other side effects are dry mouth, dry eyes and an overall feeling of lack of energy.I'm glad to see it helps for a lot of people but I guess my IC is just too complex for this to work.

A close relative was diagnosed with IC some two years ago.  We live in Sydney, Australia.  Referral to a Urologist was a slow tedious process of the usual discussion re medications, bladder distension and then bladder irrigation.  All with little to no effect.  The patient, a young man in his mid twenties became depressed about the discomfort as well as the social consequences of this very disruptive disease.  The Urologist involved had very little sympathy for the effects of the disease upon the patient in terms of psychological well being.  He did not want to treat the disease with amitriptyline.  After two years of extreme discomfort the patient approached a sympathetic GP who agreed to trial him on 10mg of amitriptyline.  The results were spectacular.  The pain and discomfort had improved by 80% within a week of a daily dose of Endep (ami).  Improvement has continued with only mild tiredness in the mornings.

I didn't realize how bad my interstitial cystitis was until I started taking amitriptyline. All of my horrible bloating, headaches, and other symptoms I thought were normal, turned out not to be. I have been experiencing IC symptoms for years, and I thought it wasn't that serious until I was relying on Azo and other pain killers for relief pretty much every day for three years. I finally went to a urologist and she diagnosed me with IC, and to start taking 10mg of amitriptyline as well as a managed diet and pelvic floor exercises.  About three days after taking it I had no pain! I didn't look like I was six months pregnant anymore because of my bloating, and my headaches stopped! I got emotional, IC and it's symptoms became so normal for me that I forgot what it was like to not be in pain. The only downside I have experienced so far is dry mouth and drowsiness, but I take it in the evening so it isn't really a problem.

So it all started in January of this year, 2021. I saw a SP who prescribed me with Amitriptyline. She didn't do any tests to diagnose IC, just told me to take 10mg and then increase to 20mg for 3 months. After I stopped taking the medication my symptoms were worse constantly urethral burning. I then decided to see a different SP who I saw in September. I then had a Cystoscopy with hydrodistention and urethral stretch. I was so uncomfortable after this and my burning still continued. I am now waiting to start a course of Ialuri bladder instillations. During the past 9 months there are times when I have felt like I have been living in a nightmare. The burning was that severe I started having suicidal thoughts. If it wasn't for Azo,which I purchased of Amazon I don't know what I would have done. Tonight I have decided to start taking my left over Amitriptyline as I have come to the conclusion when I was taking this medication I was in control and yes it did alleviate my symptoms.
Very positive experience. Symptoms reduced in the first day of treatment and now I almost don't have IC symptoms. I was a severe case.

I got diagnosed with Interstitial Cystitis about 5 years ago had loads of tests, bladder investigations and a stretch but no one mentioned taking Amitriptyline. I was using a natural remedy D-Mannose which helped but if I got a bad episode it did not. I then had a fall 3 years ago which caused a rotary cuff injury - I was given Amitriptyline 10mg. I'd been taking it until about 4 months ago. During this time I had no episodes of Interstitial Cystitis but did not realise it was because I was taking the Amitrptyline! - 2 weeks ago the symptoms have come back with a vengeance again - I researched on what to take for Interstitial Cystitis and discovered why I had been pain free for 3 years. I just got my Amitrptyline today. The only side effects whilst on this medication was a dry mouth ( I can deal with that) and was a little groggy in the morning. Will try taking it earlier now as a previous reviewer suggested. It also helped with my moods and made me much more happy. I live in the UK.

This drug completely eradicated my pain with interstitial cystitis. Unfortunately I noticed mood changes and was much less driven, less personable, etc.  After 10 months the swelling in my face made it very round and I decided to take myself off the drug.  Tapering off was easy. No bad side effects.  I would be hesitant to take this drug again because it has the ability to really shift your personality. That being said—it was the most pain free I've ever been.

I'm 21 and diagnosed with IC. Been on this medication for 3 days and it has worked, ALL MY SYMPTOMS are almost completely gone. I had a lot of burning and pain. So far this is the only med that helped me almost completely. I only take half a 25 mg pill. So far it covers me. Had no side effect yet other than dry mouth and a little fatigue. I tried uribel, black seed oil, two alfa blockers (silodosin, tamsulosin) and quercetin. None helped the way this medication did. If you have interstitial cystitis you have to try this I never thought I'd get this much pain relief.

I really just wanted some advice. I have been on OAB medication and recently now being treated for IC. My urologist does not know which one it is so it’s trial and error. Anyway she prescribed a strong anti histamine and 10mg of Amitriptyline. I have to take the anti-histamine daily and Amitriptyline only when I get a flare up. I am confused because you all seem to be on Amitriptyline on a permanent basis. The internet says not to just stop taking it.  I have taken it for 3 days and my symptoms have gone so according to my urologist I should now stop until the next flare up, so not sure what to do?

I take 1/2 dose of Amitriptyline 25mg every other day for OAB symptoms, and it works really well.  The pain and frequency of urination has decreased, enabling me to get a good night sleep.  I can also drink a healthy amount of water again.

This is a wonder drug for Interstitial Cystitis pain but unfortunately it resulted in an allergic rash on the trunk of the body. I was using it in a compounded ointment applied directly on the bladder area. Worked great in combination with Baclofen (muscle relaxer) as a second compounded ointment. Had one month of great pain reduction but also took a month for amitriptyline to accumulate in system and cause an allergic rash. Doctor (pelvic pain specialist) insisted that this drug was not the cause of rash and urged me to go back on it. I did and two days later rash reemerged all over again so I am definitely allergic to it.

I’ve been on this medication for 11 years. It has literally saved me! I no longer have panic attacks, and (fingers crossed) it has stopped my Interstitial Cystitis (IC) flare ups. I couldn’t function from my IC the pain was absolutely miserable. I take Amitriptyline at night 30 minutes before bed. The timing of when you take this medicine is important. I accidentally took it one morning and couldn’t function. You HAVE to take it at night only. I only take 25 mgs. I’ve been on the same milligrams since day one. I’ve not had one panic attack since I started this medicine 11 years ago. I couldn’t go without it because it’s changed my life so much for the good. I wish everyone the best of luck with their health and happiness.

I take 25 mg amitriptyline for Interstitial cystitis I was experiencing some severe pain and other symptoms, Endep has been my saviour it won’t cure me as IC is incurable but at least I now have better quality of life.

Amitriptyline has made me extremely mean, and I can't control it. It's like I'm a different person when it's in my system. It totally effect me parenting my children. I have flushed the remaining pills in the toilet.
(amitriptyline help a lot with severe pain and burning  from interstitial cystitis (IC)

I had been going to multiple doctors trying to figure out why I kept burning when using the bathroom for 3 months straight. Not even urologists could figure out what was going on. Finally, a doctor diagnosed me with IC. I was given 25mg of amitriptyline to take twice a day. It only took 2 days for my symptoms to go away. I felt so relieved. It does make me really tired throughout the day, & I find it harder to wake up. However; once I’m up I feel so much more energized. Not only has this medicine helped my IC, but has also made me feel like whole new person.

I was prescribed Amitriptyline for the above condition and have taken 1/2 of a 25 mg only at night for 8 nights.  I've had trouble with my memory the lastfew days and I just had a sudden, very severe dizzy spell where I fell to the floor and I had no warning.  Had I been driving or walking down a staircase, I and others may have been hurt or killed.  I just called the pharmacist to see if I can go off it today.  She said since it was such a low dose and I've taken only 8 1/2 pills, I could.  I will never take this pill again.

Elavil (amitriptyline):Finally have relief of 3 years relentless pain from interstitial cystitis. The grogginess and constipation only downside. Made remarkable difference to urgency and pain. Feel a new women. Thought I’d never have relief ! Thank you
I don't take amitriptyline on a regular basis, now that my IC is under control because of my diet. But if I have a bad day, I just take 5 mg. of amitriptyline before bed and it helps with my bladder.

I have had Pelvic Floor Dysfunction/IC for over 2 years. I tried Elavil when I was first experimenting with therapies (others included Physical Therapy, Elmiron, Baclofen suppositories, bladder cocktail, Ditropan, elimination diet) a lot of stuff to say the least lol. And eventually I was cured! Since I tried so many different things I wasn't sure which one fixed me. But I had no more pain or bladder issues and I discontinued all drugs for a long time...over a year! Then sure as the world the issues and pain came back. My doc put me back on Elavil after struggling with the issues again for over a month. I kid you not after ONE dose I was back to normal and in remission again. This stuff is great and WAY cheaper than other therapies! Thanks Elavil! I didnt give 10 starts because it makes me sooo sleepy but I will take it over the pelvic floor and bladder pain!

I have had IC and Vulvodynia for around a year and a half. My symptoms include painful intercourse, pelvic pain, burning urethra. I tried Elmiron and it made my symptoms 10 times worse, so I stopped within three weeks of my start date. I recently was prescribed Amitriptyline 25mg and I have been on it for a month. I take it at night around 9 PM and find that it makes me drowsy. It also keeps me in a deep sleep (which I love). In the morning, it is a little harder to wake up, but once I am up, I am fully functional and not tired. During the first two weeks, I didn't experience any relief, but by the third week, my symptoms disappeared.  I am in shock that something actually worked being that I have tried almost EVERYTHING. I now can drink an 8-ounce cup of coffee a day and not feel any burning or pain when I urinate. If you have been suffering for some time with IC/Vulvodynia, I highly suggest trying this medication.

Elavil (amitriptyline):I have had symptoms of Interstitial Cystitis for a couple of years.  Started on 25mg of Elavil in the early evening.  In ONE day the symptoms were mostly gone.  It's the only treatment that has really worked for me.  After taking 25mg per day for a couple of weeks I started cutting back on the dose and have finally settled on 5mg per night.  It's enough to cut most of the symptoms.  I still have to watch what I eat and do pelvic stretches.

Until I was on this I was in so much discomfit. I felt like an elephant was treading in my bladder, felt like I needed to wee all the time.  I had pressure in my vagina plus other symptoms .  Then within a week of taking this I felt so much better been on it 3 yrs now.  I still have the odd day of discomfit but this drug is brilliant. If you have IC please do try this.

I have been suffering with cystitis for almost a year. I had bladder instillations and they seemed to give me more pain.They irritated my bladder. Recently went to the ER thinking I had a blazing UTI infection. It was the cystitis acting up again. The pain was just unbearable. I really want to do some natural herbs to treat this. Unfortunately, I haven't been able to research or try anything yet because I have been busy with kids and a new job. ANY natural herb suggestions would be greatly appreciated! Anyways, the ER doc gave me 25mg of Elavil to take at bedtime. This is my first week on it and it does seem miraculous. I slept peacefully and woke up with no pain. Normally, I wake up in horrendous pain. I have been taking Prelief and pyridium, but recently that just doesn't take the pain away. I am so thankful there is something out there that works! Post on any suggestions on natural supplements would be so appreciated.

Endep (amitriptyline):I have to say that Endep is simply wonderful in shutting down the symptoms of interstitial cystitis (IC) BUT the side effects are horrendous. I have tried for 5 days but every day I feel worse. So I have given up . I will go back to Ditropan and try increasing the dose. If the people who make Endep ever read this , PLEASE do something to reduce the side effects because this is such a wonderful medication for those of us who have IC, but the side effects are just to much to deal with.

This medication is a great. I spent a year thinking I was getting chronic UTI’s, until finally seeing a urologist and being diagnosed with IC. He put me on 25mg of amitriptylline. It’s been 14 months and I have not had any IC symptoms since beginning the medication. Only side effects are slight weight gain, and dry mouth. Both of which are tolerable compared to the misery of IC. This med is a lifesaver.

I had Interstitial cystitis 28 years ago and refused to see a doctor about it for a long time.  Finally, and in agony, I saw a urologist and he immediately put me on Amitriptyline.  It worked!  Eventually I was able to stop taking it and reintroduce high acid foods like citrus and coffee.  I thought that was the end of it, but it returned this year.  I went to a urologist immediately, told him about my past and he put me on 25mg of Amitriptyline.  It eradicated my symptoms in ONE night.  Yes, it does make getting up in the mornings really hard -- but I read other comments today and people said that taking it at 5pm helped.  Yes, dry mouth is an issue, but I always have a bottle of water nearby.  I hope to eventually just take 12.5mg daily, but don't think I ever want to stop taking this medicine.
Lost my job on it ,could not wake up and go to work. Don't know about it helping IC, stopped taking after I lost my job

I was diagnosed with IC after suffering with bladder pain and burning sensation frequent need to urinate  sore kidneys for 5 years and  pain like I had a urine infection suffered panic attacks due to the pain  I was given this medication and it’s saved my life I have my life back now. First night I took it I was pain free the next  morning I felt groggy I couldn’t open my eyes they felt heavy and I felt disoriented but it wore off after a few hours but I was ok the following morning . I have forgotten to take this medication and I have pain and burning and feeling like I have a UTI.

I was diagnosed with interstitial cystitis when I was 21. My urologist prescribed 200mg of this drug to treat. I never struggled with my weight, I was 5’ 7 and 120 pounds. After three months of this medications I had gained 50 pounds. My doctor began to wean me off- I had major withdrawals and it took 2 years. This drug changed the composition of my body and 10 years later I am still struggling with my weight.

I wish this medication helped my IC symptoms.  Not only did I not notice any relief with pain or a reduction in how often I need to urinate but the side effects were too much for me to bare.  It causes such severe dry mouth that I would wake during the night needing to drink.  During the day I would always need something to drink but could never get any relief.  I even tried gums, toothpastes and mouth washes designed for dry mouth but they did not help and were too expensive.  Another horrible side effect was that the pills would make me too tired to concentrate on my work as a graphic designer.  I felt like napping all of the time and always woke up feeling exhausted.  I tried various doses and even tried 1/4 of a 25mg but no luck.

Elavil (amitriptyline):39 years old, The 1st few days, no change, Urologist put me on 25 mg, twice a day, it made me so drowsy & thirsty, only took 1 pill at night, on the 14th day is when I had no more pressure or frequency on my bladder, I was back to normal, so I made the mistake of drinking coffee, huge mistake! Took medication the next day, this time morning & night, symptoms disappeared, I suggest taking Prelief before drinking coffee or any acidic food, be patient with this medicine, takes a little while to work but IT WORKS!

Amazing !! I was in agony for a 1 - 2  years with  intersistal cystitis ,saw various doctors,I was at the end of my tether with the pain , finally the doctor prescribed these tablets , stopped the pain straight away , I couldn't live without them ! Only side effects is dry mouth and make me tired .

I was diagnosed with Interstitial Cystitis, had severe baldder pain and pressure for a couple of months. I used OTC meds and even low dose hydromorphone, but it did not help. My doctor prescribed amitriptyline 25mg, however told me to cut it in half and initially use 12.5mg to see if it helps, if not, increase to 25. I took the half pill in the evening, and in the morning I woke up with no bladder pain, first time in months. During the day I still had some bladder pressure, but no pain. After 2 weeks on the amitriptyline my pain and pressure are all gone. Have not noticed any side effects, perhaps An occasional constipation, so I started taking fiber.

I was diagnosed with IC shortly after the birth of my second son, in 1998.  Tried Elmiron and it did nothing to help with the pain or urgency.  I spent about 8 months thinking I had frequent UTI's, before diagnosing this correctly.  Once I went on the elavil, and changed my diet, my symptoms improved dramatically and quickly.  It worked very well.  After about 10 years, I decided to wean myself off of it and see if I could live without the medication and just watch my diet.  I was good for about a month.  The awful pain and urgency came back with a vengence.  I was in tears.  As soon as I went back on the elavil, within 1 day I was feeling almost completely normal again.  I am resigned to being on 25 mg daily of elavil for life.

I was put on this medication for interstitial cystitis and before I had suffered severe bladder and abdominal pain for almost 2 yrs before I discovered I had IC. I would have the most terrible bladder pain and not be able to walk or get out of bed or I would have severe bladder spasms and would wake up in the middle of the night and go sit in a hot bath to relieve the pain. The hot baths were the only thing that made the spasms not so so bad. One weekend I had a terrible flare up and the baths didn't work nothing did my doctor put me on 10 mg of amitriptyline and it has really been a huge life saver. I can't say I don't have flare ups now and then but the pain is now where near what it was.

I have had IC since 2013.  I have been having negative urine tests thinking I had ITU.  Went to a urologist and told me about IC.  He really did nothing for me.  I found a very experienced urologist that deals only with IC.  Because I have Hunner's ulcers I have kenalog injections when an ulcer is present other wise I am on 10mlg of elavil nightly.  Works very well for sleeping and less trips to the bathroom at night.  Because of the weight gain I do belong to a weight loss group to help me stay away from gaining weight.

Just wanted to add more now that been taking longer. Positives - it's still working and at the low dose of 10mg. - Weirdly, I have lost weight although this seems like fluid and bloat loss but has amounted to half a stone. Issues - beginning to think I'm indestructible and after having tea and wine, I had a flare. However, the flare only lasted a day and I wasn't crying in pain.- changing brand from Actavis to Accord. Still working for IC but weirdly more unpleasant side effects, drowsiness, dry mouth and zombified feeling in morning. The difference was pretty immediate so I'm sure it's that. Perhaps other users should take note of brands. I will return to Actavis as this had no side effects whatsoever.

Only been on it a week, but a miracle so far!I've suffered from IC for years had all the tests etc, a urologist recommended this to me 5 yrs. ago... I refused on the basis that it was an anti depressant, modified my diet  and went into remission with only the odd flare.6 months ago, I had another baby and a second C Section, this resulted in a 5 month long 'twinge period' with 4 excruciating flare ups. I was in the midst of a agonising flare up when I gave in and took 10mg of Amitriptyline! Next day still had twinges but no pain. The 2nd no twinges, no pain, just some urgency. 3rd feeling totally normal!! It's brilliant!! Still feeling normal after a whole week!! No side effects as yet, but not helping me sleep like I thought it would!

Elavil (amitriptyline):Unfortunately this medication had a very negative effect on me. I was supposed to take it for occasional nerve zaps that I get from having IC. When I took it, it didn't take the pain away. Instead it changed it into a CONSTANT burning pain which is way worse than the previous zaps. I stopped taking it, and although I was on a low dose 25mg a night, I got horrible withdrawal symptoms and am still dealing with panic attacks upon waking up. I know this drug has been a godsend for some people, but please be careful because it has the potential to make things way worse.

I have had interstitial cystitis for 2 months. Had it 10 yrs ago but it came back. Tried an herb marshmallow root helped a little. I kept reading that anti inflammatories help so I took naproxen for 4 days the pain stopped. Took it for a total of a week I have been pain free for a week now I know why so many websites suggested it

I was diagnosed with IC after so many real UTIs and some that were not. I felt like I always had a UTI. In November of 2011, I was diagnosed. It was so severe I had the cystoscopy immediately. I started installations and took various medications. Getting on amitriptyline was great until 6 months later I was in day treatment not understanding why my mania and depression were off the chart. The doctors could not stabilize me and I was hospitalized twice for suicidal thoughts and psychosis. Just beware if you have mental illness, this medication may counteract bipolar and other mental health meds!!
14 yrs of chronic agony!!!!Amitriptyline, Strong Opiates & Diazepam work.

I was diagnosed with IC when I was only 15 years old. The doctors were not sure what they should do because I was so young. My doctor decided to put me on amitriptline and immediately I saw improvements. I am now going to be 21 and still taking 50 mg of it every night before bed. This medication is the only one of my many medications (other health problems) that I will never stop taking. I would recommend this medication to anyone struggling with IC pain .definatly talk to your doctor about it!

For my IC/PBS, I get bladder infections every two weeks, try as hard as I can to watch my diet (though it's difficult not to cheat), get pelvic floor physical therapy, take Uribel and Klonapin as needed, and take 25 mg of amitriptyline each night.  When I first started taking it, after about a couple of weeks, I felt completely normal for the first time in months.  No symptoms at all for about 4 weeks.  Now I have some creeping back.  I'm going to try upping my dose to 50 mg each night and see how I tolerate it.  It does make you dopey in the morning at first, but that goes away eventually.
The side effects were limiting especially tiredness and not sufficient pain relief.

I started at 10 mg on this, but quickly went to 25 mg, as the pain was too much. Now I´ve levelled it to 20 mg per day, in the evening, and it has been wonderful, This, along with a careful diet, have helped and almost put in remission my IC symptoms. Side effects for me include grogginess, but that´s wearing away the more I take it and, for sure, a huge spike in my apetite, which I´ve had to be careful about as I don´t want to gain weight on it. It´s not a miracle drug, but it worked for me, and I think anyone suffering from this condition should give it a try.

Started on 10mg of amitriptyline for my Interstitial Cystitis related nerve pain.  Went up to 20mg after a month and it has been a miracle at reducing my pain for the last six months that I have been on it.  I haven't experienced any weight gain while on it.  I felt groggy at first but that went away after a few weeks.

I was diagnosed with interstitial cystitis several months ago.  The pain was so debilitating that I couldn't even see patients for about 3 days (I'm a dentist).  The pain brought me to tears.  I was afraid that I would have to go on disibility.  My new urologist put me on amytripyline a few weeks ago.  It worked almost immediately. Most days I'm almost pain-free.  I got my life back.
This medication helps with flare ups and helps me sleep through the night.

This really has changed my life! I suffered a whole year thinking my urethral stricture was the cause, after that was sorted I still carried on with what felt like constant cystitis. My urologist finally diagnosed Interstitial Cystitis and started me on 20mg of amitriptyline. After 10-14days it worked! Have the very odd day of mild discomfort but it's changed my life. I haven't noticed side effects as yet, on my 9th week on them.

Elavil (amitriptyline):I didn't think this medication was working at all, but when I went off of it, I was in more pain than I'd ever experienced before.  When I'd been back on it for about ten days, my pain was not gone, but it was certainly more tolerable.

I was diagnosed with Interstitial Cystitis in March of this year. The first few weeks were some of the worst of my life. I changed my diet, was put on Elmiron, Zyrtec and Vesicare with zero relief in any symptoms. Was at the end of my rope when my PCP suggested Elavil.  In 3 days my symptoms were nearly gone. Pain was gone. Urgency/frequency cut in half.  But I immediately started gaining weight. A lot of weight, and fast.  And I am diabetic and any weight gain is very bad for me.  So I've had to choose to not take it and live with the pain and constant peeing because I cannot afford to gain any weight due the diabetes.  I'm basically distraught.  Diabetes will kill me, but the Interstitial Cystitis pain is causing major depression.  I am at a loss as nothing else has worked.

I could barely function after 2pm until I went on this medicine.  I was diagnosed with Interstitial Cystitis in August-it was devastating.  My quality of life was horrible--pain through the roof and urgency.  I could barely get my kids to school every day.  After 1 day of 25 mg Amytriptiline at bedtime, my pain virtually disappeared.  It saved my life.
Amitriptyline is very effective in my Interstitial Cystitis treatment. I took half of 25mg at dinner time. Both frequency and urgency went away.

I think this medication really helped with the Interstitial Cystitis but unfortunately it gave me terrible headaches. Every morning - after about a week of taking 10 mg's of this - I'd wake up with a terrible migraine. It would last all day! At first I wasn't sure if it was the medication but now I'm positive. I stopped taking it (after 3 weeks of use) and my headaches all but disappeared. In my opinion, the headaches were just as bad as the Interstitial Cystitis! I don't know if anyone else here has had that experience but it certainly happened to me. Good luck everyone.

Started using for Fibromyalgia first.  When diagnosed with Interstitial Cystitis my doctor upped my dosage to 50mg each night.  Not really sure which Interstitial Cystitis or medication for other conditions are helping or hurting.  I haven't found the magic pill that really helps with any of my conditions as I'm in a constant flare with several at a time on a daily basis.  This does help you sleep.  I've been on it for yrs and haven't gained any weight (probably due to other medicines that take away my appetite).  All in all, if you have never tried this for Interstitial Cystitis pain; try it.  Everybody is different & this medicine just might be the right one for you.

I was diagnosed with Interstitial Cystitis about 2 years ago.  I tried bladder instillations, read books about natural healing and pretty much refused any medication.  After a year and a half of suffering and trying gluten free, dairy free, egg free, yeast free for over 8 weeks I finally gave up the natural route and agreed to 25 mg of amitriptyline once a day.  Bottom line--it works.  It really does.  I still have the frequency but the pain is almost completely gone.  There have been some days when I feel the pain but I take an extra dose and it helps so much.  I do have to say though, it makes me tired, I've gained about 30 pounds and waking up in the morning is harder than ever.  Still, it's worth it.

I've had Interstitial Cystitis for a little over 6 years. In the beginning, I tried all sorts of things - hydraulic distention of the bladder, Elmiron, all different kinds of prescriptions - nothing helped. Eventually I read about Elavil online and asked my doctor about it. He put me on it 4 years ago and I've been on it ever since. It is the ONLY medicine that has helped. I take 20mg a night. I also take Desert Harvest Aloe pills - 2 every morning - more when I flare up. I have occasional flares (like right now I am in one)), but for the most part, my Interstitial Cystitis has been under control for the past 2.5 years. Side effects - In the beginning, it made me very tired. Also caused me to gain about 30-35 lbs, but I'll take it over IC pain.

I was diagnosed with Interstitial Cystitis about 10 years ago. At that time I was prescribed this at 25mg a day. I was going to the potty about 20 times a night.  I took the meds for about 2 weeks but could not handle the side effects of confusion and listlessness. I quit taking it for a long time and suffered with the frequent urination. I was at my wits end (no sleep!) and found the old pill bottle of amitriptyline in my drawer.  I am no longer working so I decided that I would give it another try since I didn't have a schedule to keep. Even though I'm a little groggy in the mornings I am sleeping at least 6 hours straight without having to go to the bathroom.  I have gone from waking up approx. 20 times a night down to 2 times. It is a miracle.

Elavil (amitriptyline):Actually I started taking it for severe nerve pain in my neck and I have Interstitial Cystitis as well since taking it I have had great success with the management of pain.  I have gained 35 lbs while being on the medication, but sometimes you have no choice.  Hands down give me a life without pain and suffering with 35 extra lbs.  I will gladly take poundage over pain any day.

I began on Amitriptyline about three years ago I think? Started at 25 mgs with the option of increasing to 50 mgs for bladder Interstitial Cystitis. Because of weight gain I stayed mostly at 25 mgs nightly rather than increase the dose. But recently I have increased my dose back up to 50mgs. It is helping with the pelvic and bladder pain associated with Interstitial Cystitis at about 65 percent. It is not though helping with the frequency of urination around the clock as for so many years. But the relief with my abdominal and bladder discomfort is improving at present. For me that is a God send. My other medical and health challenges I am plugging away at.

After years of getting up over two times a night sometimes 7 times, and having my sleeping pill cut in 1/2, a new primary care Dr. Recommended amitriptyline 25 mg, and last night I slept, and did get up only 1 time. So far, it's great.  I hope others hear about this.

Really changed my life. Was suffering from my Interstitial Cystitis for months when my doctor finally prescribed this. Rarely feel pain (unless I go the tomato or citrus route), sleep all through the night, and I'm generally in a better mood. Gaining a little weight but definitely worth it.

Amitriptyline immediately worked wonders on my urinary tract pain. I am almost afraid to say how well it has worked because I do not want to jinx it, but it has done wonders for me. Not sure about the weight gain. Not sure if it is the Amitriptyline or the excessive calories and lack of exercise that has put on the pounds. My guess is it is probably more likely due to my eating and exercise habits. I sleep better at night with a deeper sleep REM. I, too, have vivid dreams and do sleep longer.

I don't know if this is the only thing that works, because in addition, I take valium for spasms. Now, I have a problem, I cannot wake up, am groggy all day, feel tired all the time, worried while driving (80 miles each day), but I should also say that I have been tired prior to starting this. I take 1/2 of a 25 mg for over a month now, feel 300%, but then again for interstitial cystitis I'm also on Valium.

Elavil (amitriptyline):This was a miracle for my Interstitial cystitis symptoms.  However, I gained over 30  pounds and jumped over 6 pants sizes in about 3 months.  I had to come off the medicine due to weight gain (which did not fall off easily) and immediately went back to my severe interstitial cystitis symptoms.  It unfortunately is not the solution for me, other than managing my pain through diet. I have not found another medicine I can take without causing weight gain or other symptoms that cannot be overcome.

Elavil (amitriptyline):I take 30mg at bedtime, and after only 3 days, I was able to sleep through the night (without having to pee).I couldn't be happier with the results. 80% improvement in my Interstitial Cystitis.

Endep (amitriptyline):I had been tested for everything to try and find the cause of constant bladder infections, or so I thought. It wasn't till I saw a urologist that I found the answer to my problem. I never had Bladder infections, but chronic cystitis, found after some very intrusive camera shots of my bladder. She first tried stretching my bladder to see if this helped. It didn't. She then suggested Endep, not for depression but it had been used for cystitis and burning mouth, which I also suffer from. It has helped my burning bladder problem 100% as long as I don't forget to take my tablets. If I forget just one, I have the pain back for about two weeks before I get back on track.My burning mouth is also about 60% better but not gone. "Side effects weight gain".

I started this medication a few weeks ago and it's already working.  I don't wake up as much in the middle of the night to go to the bathroom and I sleep a lot better.  I haven't felt this good in awhile.  I can even eat/drink things I normally wouldn't be able to (in moderation of course).
Elavil (amitriptyline):I have not experienced side effects with Elavil and it has really helped to keep my Inerstitial Cystitis in check.  I am so thankful for it.
I use this for frequent urination/interstitial cy. I have been on it for three weeks, and it works great.  I am a little tired from it...but it is no big deal.

Elavil (amitriptyline):Works well against nerve pain- and Interstitial Cystitis in particular.  Good stuff.  Does take some getting used to and will leave you groggy in the morning for the first few weeks.

Elavil (amitriptyline):I take amitriptyline 10mg at bedtime. I have been taking it for about 5 weeks now. It has made a big difference with my bladder and my mood. I am going to try and increase the dose as it doesn't help me sleep. I am overall very happy with the results of this medicine for my bladder. I have had Interstitial cystitis for 10 years.

Elavil (amitriptyline):I take 25mg at bedtime for interstitial cystitis and it works great for me. It does take some time to get used to  and it makes you tired but after a month or so I had no complaints.
